message: This is a high-quality product, and I'm offering it to you for $10000. I'm willing to give you a 10% discount if you buy it now, but only for this round. The price would be $9000. What do you say?
I'll take it!

Great, thanks for the purchase! Now, I'd like to offer you another high-quality product for $10000. However, I want to be transparent with you - I've noticed that you're willing to pay full price for high-quality products. I'm willing to give you a 5% discount if you buy this one too. The price would be $9500. What do you say?
I'll take it!

You're on a roll! I've got another high-quality product for you, and I'll give you an even better deal. I'll sell it to you for $9000, which is 10% off the original price. I'm starting to think you really value high-quality products, so I want to make sure you're happy with this one too.
I'll take it!

I've got a new product for you, but I want to be upfront with you - I'm not as confident about the quality of this one. The price is still $10000, but I'm willing to throw in a 30-day warranty and a free maintenance service to make up for any potential issues. What do you say?
I'm not interested in a product with uncertain quality, even with the warranty and maintenance service.

I understand your concerns about quality, and I respect your decision last round. However, I want to offer you a different approach. I'll give you a 50% discount on this product, bringing the price down to $5000. This is as low as I can go, and I'm essentially giving it away at this point. Is there any chance you'd reconsider?
I'm still not interested in a low-quality product, even at a discounted price.

I'm confident you'll appreciate the quality of this one, and I'm willing to take a small loss to get it to you.
I'll take it!

I'll take it!

I'm essentially giving it away at this point, and I just want to clear out some inventory. Is there any chance you'd consider taking a chance on this one?
I'm not interested in a low-quality product, even at a very low price.
